content.description:
Bold climb on overhanging crack system. Short albeit  stout climbing brings you to the top of the block. Topout and enjoy one of the best views in New Brunswick. Please note this climb has some loose blocks. PG

located on the highest part of the cliff in the middle of the totem block
Standard rack. Tree anchor

Fun way to get to the top of the Watchtower.



Left hand side of the Watchtower.

A light rack of nuts and cams. Tree anchor.

Short route that offers an interesting traverse and a few nice jams. Start by gaining a thin horizontal on the right. Protecting the start can be tricky, place either a small cam before turning corner or a blind peice around the corner. Then traverse left until you can gain a crack that will take you to that top.



Follow the trail to the Watchtower, this route climbs the block to the left of easter Island looking block. Locate a hand crack that splits half the block start down and right of this crack. 

A few cams, small cams are useful to protect start. Cedar tree for anchor.

Climb up the short blocky chimney. Very causal and relatively secure climbing. More of a boulder than a climb.



The prominent block to the left of "THE Watchtower " there is a short chimney on the back right corner.

tree anchor.

Follow the short but fun cracks to the top. Gear is straightforward, be aware of rock quality. My only complaint about this route is its not 100ft longer.



The start of this route is located to the right of The Watchtower on a short face. Start under obvious cracks in a short corner.

A few cams. Tree anchor

climbs.name: The Weigh In
climbs.fa: Caleb Mazurkiewicz, Dalton MacNeil and Duncan Gillies

content.description:
More of a scramble than a climb, usually soloed. Climb the tight chimney around the back right side of the Watchtower. Be aware some of the chalked stones move. For an additional challenge try to squeeze out the hole near back at the top.



From the main face head left towards the creek. Take the first trail that cuts up the cliff on your right. The trail is marked with orange flagging and some old pots and pans. You will soon see a fixed blue line, use this to scramble up a short cliff. Follow the orange flagging that takes you up the steep hill to the base of the Watchtower. This route can be found around the back right side of the prominate block.

A double length sling and a couple cams
Totem block located on the highest part of the cliff. Slightly overhanging face with interesting features.
